footer.license: Includes icons from Remix Icon (MIT License)

home.title: Welcome to NUI
home.subtitle: A modern, customizable Angular component library
home.description: Build beautiful applications with our comprehensive set of UI components

installation.title: Installation
installation.subtitle: Get started with NUI in your Angular project
installation.step1Description: Use npm or yarn to install the NUI package in your project.
installation.step2Description: Configure NUI in your application config file. Define the preset you want to use and the theme mode.
installation.step3Description: You can import NUI styles in three different ways: in your global styles.scss file, in angular.json, or in project.json if you're using Nx.
installation.step4Description: You can now use any NUI component in your HTML templates.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.subtitle: Configure NUI to match your needs
configuration.presetConfigDescription: Presets define your application's color palette. NUI includes 8 pre-built presets: aura, warm, neon, dopamine, corporate, minimal, sunset, and ocean.
configuration.darkModeConfigDescription: Control how dark mode is applied in your application. Available options are: 'manual' (controlled by code), 'auto' (based on time of day), or 'system' (according to OS preferences).
configuration.customPresetConfigDescription: Create your own preset by defining custom colors for light and dark modes. Each preset must include: primary, secondary, accent, success, info, warning, and danger.

theming.title: Theming & Presets
theming.subtitle: Customize the look and feel of your application
theming.description: NUI comes with multiple pre-built presets. Each preset defines a unique color palette that can be applied to all components.

presetDescriptions.aura: Default modern and elegant palette with teal and purple tones
presetDescriptions.warm: Energetic palette with warm coral and golden tones, perfect for e-commerce
presetDescriptions.neon: Futuristic cyberpunk palette with electric cyan and neon colors, ideal for gaming
presetDescriptions.dopamine: Optimistic and cheerful palette with bright lime and pink tones
presetDescriptions.corporate: Professional blue palette, perfect for business and enterprise applications
presetDescriptions.minimal: Refined minimalist palette with subtle colors and elegant purple accent
presetDescriptions.sunset: Warm and vibrant palette with rose, pink and orange tones, perfect for creative apps
presetDescriptions.ocean: Calm and professional palette with deep blues and aqua tones, ideal for productivity

button.title: Button
button.subtitle: Versatile button component with multiple variants, sizes, and states

basic.title: Basic Button
basic.description: The simplest form of a button with default styling.

variants-colors.title: Variants & Colors
variants-colors.description: Buttons come in three variants: solid (default), outline, and ghost, and support all theme colors: primary, secondary, accent, success, info, warning, and danger.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Five size options available: xs, sm, md (default), lg, and xl.

icons.title: With Icons
icons.description: Add icons to buttons at the start or end position. Buttons with only an icon are rendered as circular icon buttons.
icons.note: Icon position: 'start' displays the icon before text, 'end' displays it after. Icon-only buttons require the aria-label attribute for accessibility.

loading.title: Loading State
loading.description: Display a loading spinner in three positions: start, end, or center (which replaces the content).
loading.note: Loading positions: 'start' shows spinner before text, 'end' shows it after, 'center' replaces content entirely with centered spinner.

width.title: Width
width.description: Control button width: auto (default), full (100%), or fit (fit-content).
width.note: Width options: 'auto' adapts to content with standard padding, 'full' stretches to 100% of container, 'fit' uses minimum space needed.

disabled.title: Disabled State
disabled.description: Disabled buttons prevent user interaction and display a dimmed appearance.

events.title: Events
events.description: Handle click events with the onClick output. Supports button types: button, submit, and reset.
events.consoleNote: Open DevTools (F12) and check the Console tab to see the events being logged when you click the buttons.

directive.title: Using Directive
directive.description: Apply button styling to native HTML elements using the nuiButton directive. Works with <button> and <a> elements.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of Button component inputs and outputs for integration into your projects.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the button appearance using CSS variables. Control sizes, typography, colors, and more.

actionMenu.title: Action Menu
actionMenu.subtitle: Dropdown menu component with support for static, dynamic items and submenus

basic.title: Basic Usage
basic.description: Simple action menu with items array. Each item can have a label, icon, and action.
basic.note: Here we see an example of using both type='static' and type='dynamic'.
basic.consoleNote: Open DevTools (F12) and check the Console tab to see the actions being logged when you click menu items.

separators.title: With Separators
separators.description: Group related actions using visual separators. Use separator: true for simple separators, or add a label for labeled separators.

submenu.title: With Submenus
submenu.description: Create nested menus using the children property. Submenus can be nested multiple levels deep.
submenu.note: Use the children property to define submenu items. Each child can also have its own children for deeper nesting. Note: If a child has selected: true, the parent item will show a visual indicator (vertical line on the left) to aid navigation.

variants.title: Button Variants
variants.description: The menu button supports three variants: 'ghost' (default), 'solid', and 'outline'.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Five size options for the menu button: 'xs', 'sm', 'md' (default), 'lg', and 'xl'.

label.title: With Label
label.description: Add text to the menu button. Can be combined with icons and supports full width mode.

disabled.title: Disabled State
disabled.description: Disable individual menu items or the entire menu. Disabled items are shown but not clickable.

withSubtitle.title: With Subtitle
withSubtitle.description: Add secondary text below the main label. Useful for displaying additional information like emails, descriptions, or shortcuts.

selected.title: Selected State
selected.description: Mark items as selected to show the current choice. A check icon appears automatically. Perfect for selectors, filters, or settings.

colors.title: Descriptive Icons
colors.description: Use meaningful icons and labels to communicate the purpose of each action. Icons help users quickly identify actions.

template.title: Custom Template
template.description: Fully customize menu rendering using templates and directives. Use menu-header and menu-footer to add content at the start and end without needing ng-template.
template.note: The #item template receives the full item as context (let-item). The menu-header and menu-footer directives provide a simpler and clearer syntax than PrimeNG, avoiding unnecessary ng-templates.
template.clickNote: Important: When using custom templates, you must handle the click event manually with (click)="handleAction(item)". The onItemAction event is only automatically emitted with default items.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of inputs, outputs, and the ActionMenuItem interface for integrating the component into your projects.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the menu appearance using CSS variables. Control colors, spacing, typography, and more.

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.subtitle: Graphic component to represent users, entities or brands through images, letters or icons

basic.title: Basic Usage
basic.description: Display a simple avatar by loading an external image. This is the most common way to represent a user.

types.title: Content Types and Priority
types.description: The component intelligently decides what to show based on available data. This logic ensures something meaningful is always displayed.
types.note: Rendering priority: 1. Image (if loads) > 2. Initials > 3. Icon > 4. Fallback (Alt Letter) > 5. Default icon.

variants.title: Shape Variants
variants.description: Avatar supports three geometric shapes to adapt to different design contexts: circular (default), rounded, and square.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Five predefined sizes that harmoniously scale the container, typography, and icons: xs, sm, md, lg, and xl.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: Customize background and text color using the system palette. Ideal for differentiating users or states when there's no image.

customSize.title: Custom Size
customSize.description: Define exact dimensions in pixels when standard sizes don't fit. Font size and icons are calculated proportionally automatically.
customSize.note: The customSize input overrides the size input. Internal calculation maintains initials readability.

error.title: Error Handling (Fallback)
error.description: Automatic recovery system. If the image URL fails (404 error), the component instantly switches to showing initials or fallback icon without breaking the design.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of Avatar component inputs and outputs for integration into your projects.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the avatar appearance using CSS variables. Control sizes, colors, borders, and more.

buttonGroup.title: Button Group
buttonGroup.subtitle: Set of grouped buttons for single (Radio) or multiple (Checkbox) selection

basic.title: Basic Usage
basic.description: The simplest case accepts an array of strings. By default, acts as a single option selector (Radio).

modes.title: Selection Modes
modes.description: Allows changing the button selection type between radiobutton and checkbox
modes.note: Switch to mode='checkbox' to allow selecting multiple options at once. The returned value will be an Array.

segmented.title: Segmented Variant
segmented.description: Visual style like 'iOS Segmented Control'. Ideal for view switchers (e.g., Month/Year, List/Map).
segmented.note: Use visualVariant='segmented' to apply this unique style.

complex.title: Complex Objects
complex.note: Map properties of arbitrary objects using labelBy, valueBy, and disabledBy.

icons.title: With Icons
icons.note: Support for Remix Icon icons. Use iconOnly='true' for a compact toolbar-style button bar.

styles.title: Styles and Sizes
styles.description: Compatible with NUI's entire variant system (Solid, Outline, Ghost), colors, and sizes (xs, sm, md, lg, xl).
styles.note: Combine color, variant, and size to customize appearance according to your needs.

width.title: Full Width
width.note: Use width='full' to make buttons expand and occupy all available space evenly.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of inputs, outputs, and advanced usage of the Button Group component.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the button group appearance using CSS variables. Control spacing, colors, shadows, and more.

paginator.title: Paginator
paginator.subtitle: Advanced component for data navigation with support for flexible layouts and infinite loading

basic.title: Basic Usage
basic.description: Standard configuration with numeric navigation. Supports bidirectional binding of page and size.

styles.title: Styles and Variants
styles.description: Supports all system colors, variants (Solid, Outline, Ghost), and predefined modes like 'Minimal'.

layout.title: Custom Layout
layout.description: The most powerful feature. Define exactly where each element goes (top, left, center, right, bottom) using a configuration object.
layout.note: Area System: You can move the size selector to the left, put the item summary on top, or create any composition your design needs. When a layout is set, attributes like showPageSizeSelector, showFirstLast, showItemRange, and showPageJump are ignored because the custom layout has full control over what to show and where.

infinite.title: Infinite Load / Load More
infinite.description: Transform the paginator into a 'Load More' button with integrated loading state. Ideal for mobile lists or feeds.

sizes.title: Page Size Options
sizes.description: Define a custom set of options for page size.
sizes.note: Using the size input you can offer users a specific set of page sizes to choose from.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of Paginator component inputs, outputs, and interfaces for advanced integration.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the paginator appearance using CSS variables. Control layout, buttons, page numbers, and more.

popover.title: Popover
popover.subtitle: Interactive floating content component with support for text, templates, and dynamic components

basic.title: Basic Usage
basic.description: Simple popover with text content. The popover displays on clicking the element (default behavior).

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control the preferred popover position: top, bottom, left, or right. The popover automatically repositions if there's insufficient space.

events.title: Trigger Events
events.description: Define how the popover activates: click (default), hover, focus, or manual. Manual mode allows complete programmatic control.

template.title: Custom Template
template.description: Use Angular templates for rich, interactive content. The template context provides a close function to close the popover.

component.title: Dynamic Component
component.description: Render complete Angular components inside the popover. Ideal for forms, lists, or complex content.

delays.title: Show/Hide Delays
delays.description: Configure delays in milliseconds before showing or hiding the popover. Useful for improving user experience in hover mode.

customization.title: Customization
customization.description: Customize popover appearance: no arrow, custom width, own CSS classes, or greater separation offset.

closeOptions.title: Close Options
closeOptions.description: Control how the popover can be closed: click outside, Escape key, or allow multiple simultaneous popovers.

backdrop.title: With Backdrop
backdrop.description: Add a dark background behind the popover to create a modal experience. You can control whether clicking the backdrop closes the popover or not.

disabled.title: Disabled State
disabled.description: Dynamically control whether the popover is enabled or disabled using the popoverDisabled property.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of the nuiPopover directive, injection tokens, and advanced usage.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the popover appearance using CSS variables. Control colors, size, shadows, and animations.

toast.title: Toast
toast.subtitle: Non-intrusive temporary notifications for user feedback

basic.title: Basic Toasts
basic.description: Display simple notifications with different types: success, error, warning, and info.

withTitle.title: Toasts with Title
withTitle.description: Add a title to give more context to the notification.

withActions.title: Toasts with Actions
withActions.description: Include action buttons so users can interact with the notification.

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control where toasts appear on screen: top-left, top-center, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Configure how long the toast remains visible before disappearing. Use 0 for toasts that don't close automatically.

loading.title: Loading Toast
loading.description: Display a toast with loading state that can be dynamically updated when the operation completes.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of ToastService, interfaces, and advanced usage of the notification system.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the toast appearance using CSS variables. Control colors, size, animations, and more.

tooltip.title: Tooltip
tooltip.subtitle: Informative tooltips with support for text and custom templates

basic.title: Basic Tooltips
basic.description: Display simple tooltips with text on hover.
basic.note: You can disable the arrow with tooltipShowArrow.

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control tooltip position relative to the element: top (default), bottom, left, right.

events.title: Events
events.description: Define which event triggers the tooltip: hover (default), click, focus, or manual for programmatic control.

template.title: Custom Template
template.description: Use Angular templates for rich content with HTML formatting, icons, and styling.

delays.title: Show/Hide Delays
delays.description: Configure delays in milliseconds before showing or hiding the tooltip. Useful to prevent unwanted tooltips on quick hovers.

customization.title: Customization
customization.description: Customize tooltip appearance: no arrow, custom width, own CSS classes, or maximum width.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete documentation of the nuiTooltip directive with all available inputs and outputs.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the tooltip appearance using CSS variables. Override these variables in your global styles or component styles.

sidebar-panel.title: Sidebar Panel
sidebar-panel.subtitle: Sliding side panels with CDK Overlay for displaying dynamic content

basic.title: Basic Usage
basic.description: Open a side panel from the SidebarPanelService. The panel slides in from the screen edge with smooth animation.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: The Sidebar Panel component supports six predefined sizes: xs (300px), sm (400px), md (600px - default), lg (800px), xl (1000px), and full (100%).

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control which side of the screen the panel slides from: right (default), left, top, or bottom.

dynamicComponent.title: Dynamic Component
dynamicComponent.description: Load any Angular component inside the panel and pass data through dependency injection using SIDEBAR_PANEL_DATA token.

minimizable.title: Minimizable Panel
minimizable.description: Panels can be minimized to a sidebar tab to free up screen space while preserving their state. Click the minimize button in the header or use programmatic control. You can also restore the panel by clicking the minimized tab, depending on the Sidebar's position, or by clicking the element that created the panel.
minimizable.note:
Use the minimize() method of the SidebarPanel to minimize the panel programmatically. The panel shrinks to a sidebar tab that can be expanded again by clicking. If minimizable is enabled, the id attribute is required to identify the minimized panel.

Tab customization: You can customize the icon, add text, apply custom CSS, or use a completely custom template via minimizedTabCustomization. For floating buttons with free positioning (e.g., chat bottom-right), use standalone: true to render outside the grouped container and avoid positioning constraints.

closeButton.title: Close Button
closeButton.description: Control the visibility of the close button in the panel header.

noBackdrop.title: Without Backdrop
noBackdrop.description: Open panels without the dark overlay background. Useful for non-modal panels that allow interaction with the page.

customBackdrop.title: Custom Backdrop
customBackdrop.description: Customize the backdrop with custom CSS classes. You can apply effects like blur, custom colors, and transitions.

multiple.title: Multiple Panels
multiple.description: Open multiple panels simultaneously from different sides. Control z-index stacking and close all at once.

api.title: API
api.description: Available interfaces and methods of the SidebarPanel component.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the panel appearance through CSS variables. You can override these variables in your custom theme.
